details: The scheme "Development of Brackish Water Aquaculture" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to enhance the income of brackish water fishermen by promoting modern shrimp farming techniques, improving disease control methods, increasing employment, and boosting shrimp exports.

benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% subsidy on unit cost of Rs.50, 000/- or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy is given to Shrimp Farm owner

benefits.Name of Component: Subsidy on Construction of New shrimp farm
benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% subsidy on unit cost of Rs.7.00 lakh per Hector or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy is given to land owner or beneficiary should have land on lease for 10 years

benefits.Name of Component: Subsidy on Renovation of shrimp farm
benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% subsidy on unit cost of Rs.20, 000/- Per hector or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy is given to Shrimp Farm owner

benefits.Name of Component: Subsidy on Bird Fencing / Dog Fencing
benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% subsidy on unit cost of Rs. 10,000/- per hector for bird fencing and 50% subsidy of unit cost of Rs. 25,000/- per hector for dog fencing
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy is given to Shrimp Farm owner

benefits.Name of Component: Subsidy on purchase of shrimp feed and seed
benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% subsidy on unit cost of Rs.3.00 lakh per Hector or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy is given to Shrimp Farm owner

benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% subsidy on unit cost of Rs.8000/- or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less for tube net and 50% subsidy on unit cost of Rs.3000/- or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less for raft
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy on purchasing of tube net/Raft is given for culture of the sea weed

benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% of unit cost of Rs. 11,00,000/- per hector or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy is given to Shrimp Farm owner

benefits.Standard of Assistance: 50% of unit cost of Rs. 400.00 lakh or 50% of the actual cost incurred whichever is less
benefits.Remarks: Subsidy is given to land owner or beneficiary should have land on lease for 10 years

eligibility: The applicant must have own land or government-allotted land for shrimp farming.
Shrimp Farm of the Beneficiary should have been registered with coastal aquaculture authority or beneficiary should have been applied for it.
The beneficiary must have his own bank account.
The applicant must provide valid identity proof (Voter ID, Aadhaar Card, Ration Card, or Passport).
application_process: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.
Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.
Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.
Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.
Once the application is done, confirm it.
Take a print out of the confirmed application and submit Related Documents through to concern Taluka office.
documents_required: Shrimp farm registration certificate (or application receipt for registration).
